Title: Behavioral effects of triadimefon in zebrafish are associated with alterations of the dopaminergic and serotonergic pathways
Authors: Susana Paredes-Zúñiga, Nils Trost, Javiera F De La Paz, Julio Alcayaga, Miguel L Allende
Venue: Progress in Neuro-psychopharmacology and Biological Psychiatry
Supporting quotes for "Exposure duration:
- "at room temperature (23-26 °C) for 10 h under constant illumination."
  - "5 dpf larvae were incubated in 96-well multiwell plates with 200 μL of TDF ranging from 5 mg/L to 35 mg/L at room temperature (23-26 °C) for 10 h under constant illumination."
  - "5 dpf larvae (n = 30-50) were incubated with TDF 5 mg/L for 15 min."
Reasoning for "Exposure duration":
The paper states that for the behavioral experiments, 5 dpf larvae were incubated in TDF ranging from 5 mg/L to 35 mg/L "at room temperature (23-26 °C) for 10 h under constant illumination":
"5 dpf larvae were incubated in 96-well multiwell plates with 200 μL of TDF ranging from 5 mg/L to 35 mg/L at room temperature (23-26 °C) for 10 h under constant illumination."
The paper also mentions that for the gene expression experiments, 5 dpf larvae were exposed to 5 mg/L TDF "for 15 min":
"5 dpf larvae (n = 30-50) were incubated with TDF 5 mg/L for 15 min."
Since the question is asking about the exposure duration in the behavioral experiments, the relevant exposure duration is 10 hours.

Title: Carbofuran induces increased anxiety-like behaviors in female zebrafish (Danio rerio) through disturbing dopaminergic/ norepinephrinergic system
Authors: Shuang Liu, Miao Yu, Xincen Xie, Yiran Ru, Shaoguo Ru, David Volz
Supporting quotes for "Exposure duration:
- "After 48 h, apart from the fish for behavioral tests (18e22 fish per treatment group), the other fish were dissected to obtain the brain."
  - "Fish were exposed to various concentrations of carbofuran or 0.005% (v/v) DMSO for 48 h, and the exposure solutions were totally replaced every 24 h."
Reasoning for "Exposure duration":
The paper states that the exposure duration for the behavioral experiments was 48 hours:
"Fish were exposed to various concentrations of carbofuran or 0.005% (v/v) DMSO for 48 h, and the exposure solutions were totally replaced every 24 h."
"After 48 h, apart from the fish for behavioral tests (18e22 fish per treatment group), the other fish were dissected to obtain the brain."
The paper also mentions that the exposure duration for the neurotransmitter analysis was the same 48 hours:
"Zebrafish used for neurotransmitter-targeted metabolic testing were exposed to 20 L treatment solution in 30-L glass aquarium, with 30 fish per aquarium and 4 aquariums per treatment group (50 mg/L carbofuran and solvent control, respectively). After a 48-h exposure, the brain from 25 fish were pooled as one replicate for LC-MS/MS analysis (n ¼ 4), and 5 brains were pooled as one replicate for ELISA (n ¼ 4)."

Title: Quantitative assessment of cypermethrin induced behavioural and biochemical anomalies in adult zebrafish
Supporting quotes for "Exposure duration: - "For the screening of effective dose of cypermethrin which can be used for the induction of behavioural abnormalities upon short exposure, adult zebrafish in a group of five fishes per treatment were exposed for 30 min to different test concentrations of cypermethrin viz. 0 μg/L (0 ppb) (used as control), or 0.25 μg/L (0.25 ppb), 2.5 μg/L (2.5 ppb) and 25 μg/L (25 ppb) concentration of cypermethrin."
Reasoning for "Exposure duration":
The paper states that the adult zebrafish were exposed to different concentrations of cypermethrin for 30 minutes:
"For the screening of effective dose of cypermethrin which can be used for the induction of behavioural abnormalities upon short exposure, adult zebrafish in a group of five fishes per treatment were exposed for 30 min to different test concentrations of cypermethrin viz. 0 μg/L (0 ppb) (used as control), or 0.25 μg/L (0.25 ppb), 2.5 μg/L (2.5 ppb) and 25 μg/L (25 ppb) concentration of cypermethrin."
"For the investigation of cypermethrin potential to induce behavioural abnormalities, five adult zebrafish per treatment group (control and 25 μg/L cypermethrin) were used per trial. The trials were repeated more than three times on different days (Supplementary Table 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1 ). Briefly, adult zebrafish of mixed gender were randomly selected from their housing tank and gently transferred to two tanks viz. the control tank containing no cypermethrin and the treatment tank containing 25 μg/L of cypermethrin as final concentration. Fishes were exposed for 30 min in their respective treatment tanks and then individually transferred to the behavioural imaging setup as described earlier (Nema et al., 2016)."
The paper clearly states that the adult zebrafish were exposed to cypermethrin for 30 minutes.

Title: Zebrafish provide a sensitive model of persisting neurobehavioral effects of developmental chlorpyrifos exposure: Comparison with nicotine and pilocarpine effects and relationship to dopamine deficits

- "All treatments were performed on the first five days of development even though the behavioral assessments were done in adulthood."

  - "Embryonic to larval and adult zebrafish (Danio rerio) were used for the current study.
